channel.title: Fixer-up
channel.description:
[img]http://i38.tinypic.com/34eaoms.jpg[/img]
Well me and my brother bought this '96 mustang for $1700. We have got it running. Today we went and got a diagnostics on it, we need to figure out why the battery connection is loose and the pressure release valve is clogged. Some things we are going to do in the future is paint the mustang a burnt orange color, and get some 5 spoke mustang racing rims that are painted orange in the inside and are chrome on the outside. After that we will probably start upgrading the actual motor etc.

item.title: Fixer-up
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:14, topic:310730”][quote author=Elijah link=topic=407158.msg3012612#msg3012612 date=1256941708]

That’s an ugly Mustang… (you get what you pay for I guess)

Definitely repaint it…

When you’re actually old enough to drive legally. You’ll appreciate what you can pay for. In fact, I’d bet this car would smoke your bicycle.
[/quote]
Lol, I was just saying that it was ugly. I understand that if that’s all he can afford, that’s what he should get. It’s not as if I’ve never had to compromise looks for price. And yes, his car is definitely better then my bike.[/quote]My parents don’t pay for our cars… When we were 10, they would get us doing things for money and earning it… So by the time we were 16 we could buy our own vehicles…

Read full topic

Fucking hell you get some nice cars for cheap over there. I swear the only things going cheap in the UK are corsas and fiestas.

item.title: Fixer-up
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Starting up …, post:9, topic:310730”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=407158.msg3009065#msg3009065 date=1256615751]

[quote author=Starting up … link=topic=407158.msg3008519#msg3008519 date=1256589269]

What do you mean you have to figure out why the battery connection is loose? Can’t you just tighten it? And what do you mean by a pressure relief valve?
[/quote]The connection is tight and there is no corrosion on anything… But the diagnostics came up saying the connection was loose. My brother said something about the pressure valve on the engine was clogged. All I know is that its a very small tube on the engine that you can buy for like $2

Gotcha, you mean PCV valve, not pressure valve.

Battery cables do get corroded, they aren’t hard to replace or expensive, you could always replace one or both.
[/quote]I didn’t mean the cables getting corroded but what you connect them to the (+) and (-)[/quote]

I know, you can see and clear up that kind of corrosion, but if the cables are corroded inside, you just have to replace them.

Read full topic
